intro: Androsace asprella, commonly known as the alpine sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its compact rosette of fleshy, hairy leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers during the summer months, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Androsace asprella is often found in alpine meadows and is valued for its ornamental appearance and ecological role in mountain ecosystems.
